Make your tablet or smart phone Point-of-Sale (POS) system with PlusBit.\r\n\r\nWhy use this instead of a mobile wallet?\r\nOne of the main reasons a merchant would use this app over the standard mobile wallet would be to have an experience they are familiar with. Tapping on one of these \"deltas\" will update the two charts.\r\n\r\nA historical price chart shows you how Litecoin prices for two exchanges have changed over 24 hours up to 12 months. Pan and zoom using pinch and swipe or tap for a full screen chart.\r\n\r\nFinally, a historical \"delta\" chart shows you how the difference in prices of Litecoin (after commissions) have changed over time.  This chart can be used to identify arbitrage opportunities.  The size of the square in the chart represents the length of time the opportunity existed.  In other words, opportunities that have spanned longer periods of time are easier to capture and are represented by large squares.  Similarly, tiny squares represent opportunities that spanned short periods of time.\r\n\r\nTo learn more about Litecoin Delta, visit our product page: www.onyxsoftware.co.nz/litecoindelta","descriptionHTML":"Litecoin Delta is THE tool for identifying and monitoring Litecoin arbitrage opportunities between nine USD/Litecoin exchanges: Wex, Bitfinex, Bitstamp, Bittrex, Gdax, Kraken, Poloniex, OKCoin and CrxZone.<br><br>Features:<br>- Real-time display of prices from multiple sources simultaneously<br>- Swipe/Pinch to pan/zoom historical price chart<br>- Tap to toggle full screen chart<br>- Historical prices as far back as 1 year<br><br>This app has what other &quot;ticker&quot; apps are missing:<br><br>A real-time display of live prices (straight from the exchange) and the deltas for all combinations of the exchanges currently implemented. And most likely it is not one person, but a group of people. But so far, it has not been possible to establish who exactly created Bitcoin.\r\nThe smallest unit of Bitcoin ‚Äúsatoshi‚Äù is named after its creator.\r\n\r\n- How old is Bitcoin? Bitcoin\r\n's birthday is January 3, 2009 (if Bitcoin were a human, it would be a Capricorn in the zodiac sign). It was on this day that the first block and the first 50 BTC coins were generated.\r\nSoon, the first transaction involving the cue ball was conducted: On January 12, Satoshi Nakamoto sent Hal Finney 10 BTC. And the first exchange of Bitcoins for fiat money took place in September 2009.\r\nThat is, in 2020, Bitcoin turned as much as 11 years old \r\n\r\n-How many BTC are there in total?\r\nThe first cryptocurrency is distinguished by a limited issue. I promised in simple language, sorry to translate: the maximum number of bits is known in advance and is embedded in the program code of the coin. Thus, a total of 21 million BTC will be issued and no more coins will be issued.\r\nAt the same time, as the number of coins already in circulation increases, it becomes more difficult to extract new ones.\r\nThe last coin is expected to be mined in 2140.\r\n\r\n-How much has already been extracted?\r\nCurrently, more than 18.65 million rubles are in circulation. The number of coins mined changes approximately every 10 minutes as new blocks are created.\r\n\r\nLet's get back to our project. We encourage our users to use Bitcoin as an investment and a currency to use in the trade of goods and services. We require no personal information when signing up, so users can remain anonymous. We are a non-custodial wallet, so users can send Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies globally with direct access to the blockchain. \r\n\r\nWith Coinpay you can easily purchase (with debit card, credit card, and Apple Pay), send, and receive Bitcoin, Litecoin, and Ethereum. Each live value is given position on 5 levels‚Äô scale: strong sell, sell, neutral, buy and strong buy and the sum of 3 positions is generated to main trading signal per each of Coinbase Pro symbols. & Atomic swap DEX","description":"Atomex ‚Äî is a non-custodial crypto wallet with a built in Atomic swap decentralized exchange (DEX). You can store, use and swap cryptocurrencies between different blockchains like Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), Litecoin (LTC), Tezos (XTZ) as well as tokens USDT (ERC20 token), tzBTC (Tezos wrapped Bitcoin), TBTC, WBTC (Ethereum wrapped Bitcoin) without intermediaries from your mobile wallet.\r\n\r\nWhat makes Atomex wallet special?\r\nAtomex Hybrid exchange combines advantages of centralized and decentralized exchanges:\r\n‚Ä¢ You're in control: Private keys are kept encrypted on your mobile wallet. Cross-blockchain transactions are carried out using Atomic Swaps.\r\n‚Ä¢ No additional fees: You pay only a miner fee for both regular and cross-blockchain atomic swap transactions.\r\n‚Ä¢ Stay incognito: No registration or identity verification required because Atomex is a non-custodial cryptocurrency wallet.\r\n‚Ä¢ Audited: All blockchain atomic swap smart-contracts and crypto wallet core library audited by LeastAuthority.\r\n‚Ä¢ Staking Tezos: Delegate your Tezos (XTZ) to trusted bakers from the Baking Bad list and bring an income.\r\nWhat is Atomic Swap exchange?\r\nAtomic swap is a technology for secure exchange of digital assets without the need to trust a third party. It‚Äôs as secure as cryptographic primitives and blockchain implementation it's based on. It's mathematically proved that in every scenario you either succeed with an exchange or get your money back. Atomex uses an on-chain implementation based on hashed timelock smart-contracts.\r\n\r\nHow long does an atomic swap take?\r\nDepending on the chosen pair of cryptocurrency, the exchange may take from several minutes to an hour. The maximum time is 6 hours, after which the coins are returned to your crypto wallet.\r\n\r\nHow are private keys stored?\r\nYour private keys are stored ONLY on your mobile wallet device, encrypted using AES-256. You have to unlock your crypto wallet with the encryption password on every start.\r\n\r\nStaking Tezos\r\nStake Tezos (XTZ) from your own wallet with a delegation function. It brings passive income automatically. Delegation in Tezos is absolutely safe. Your coins are not locked or frozen and do not move anywhere. You can spend them at any time and without any delay from your Atomex wallet. Just keep in mind, you only delegate your rights, that‚Äôs it. Atomex wallet uses Tezos Baking Bad baker‚Äôs list. So you can be sure you stake your Tezos (XTZ) with trusted bakers.\r\n\r\nHD crypto wallet\r\nHD (Hierarchical Deterministic) Crypto Wallet ‚Äî is a standard for generating a hierarchical tree-like structure of private/public addresses (keys), so that you can create as many wallets as you like and restore all of them from a single seed phrase.\r\n\r\nOpen-source\r\nAtomex is an open-source project by the Baking Bad team, which is known in the Tezos community as one of the most active ecosystem contributors.\r\n\r\nYou can leave a feedback or ask us any question via email: support@atomex.me","descriptionHTML":"Atomex ‚Äî is a non-custodial crypto wallet with a built in Atomic swap decentralized exchange (DEX). Select Algorithm or CryptoCoin.\r\n2. Enter the number of threads: Default is Core count. Fewer than Core count is recommended.\r\n3. Enter Mining pool server URL: Enter the server URL of the mining pool you are using or select a server for Minergate or Nicehash which is automatically entered. Mining pools are Minergate, Nicehash, MiningPoolHub, and so on. Most of Server URL is starting with \"stratum+tcp://\".\r\n3. Enter Username: Enter the username of your mining pool. If you do not have an account, touch \"Create Account\" to create an account. A common username type is E-mail or Username.Worker.\r\n4. Enter Password: Default is x, most mining pools do not require a real password at mining. In most cases, you can only enter x in your password.\r\n5. Click the \"Start\" button\r\n6. Later you can withdraw cryptocoin from mining pool to your wallet or exchange market wallet such as Poloniex, Bittrex, Bitfinex and so on.\r\n\r\n* ex\r\nAlgorithm: XMR(Monero)\r\nServer URL: pool.\r\n- AA Miner does not require special permissions such as accessibility.\r\n- If it freeze your device, use less number of threads.\r\n- Turn off battery optimization for background mining.\r\n- Don't put any white spaces in Server URL / Username / Password.\r\n\r\n* Features\r\n- Background mining(Turn off battery optimization.Also we recommend to screen on for continuous mining You can also compare the performance of Bitcoin in different currencies (Euro, Dollar, Sterling) and even measure Bitcoin against Altcoins like Ethereum, Bitcoin Cash, Litecoin, Ripple, IOTA, XLM, EOS & DASH.\r\n\r\n‚òÜ Change & Volatility Monitor:\r\nThe Change & Volatility Monitor describes the direction and magnitude of price fluctuations. If Bitcoin performed positively within the given time span, it is colored in green. Otherwise it is colored in red. Further intervals allow you to examine the price action more closely. The displayed price for an interval is the average price of all exchanges for that moment. Its relative change compared to the price 24 hours ago gives you an understanding of the trend and volatility of the market.\r\n\r\n‚òÜ Cross Coin Check\r\nOur Cross Coin Check gives you a broad insight into market developments and allows you to compare Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), Ripple (XRP), Bitcoin Cash (BCH), Litecoin (LTC) and IOTA (MIOTA) among each other. For this purpose, we continuously calculate all the prices and calculate the relation to each other. It is important for us to emphasize that the prices are obtained directly and unaltered by the exchanges! That means, our exchange rates are not manipulated (yes, we're hinting at 'Coinmarketcap').\r\n\r\n‚òÜ Trade Signals\r\nOur purely AI driven trade signals provide you with up-to-date trade recommendations. –≤ –º–∏—Ä —Ü–∏—Ñ—Ä–æ–≤—ã—Ö –≤–∞–ª—é—Ç –≤ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–º –º–µ—Å—Ç–µ.\r\n\r\n–í—Å—ë –≤ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–º\r\n–ö—É–ø–∏—Ç—å, –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞—Ç—å, –æ–±–º–µ–Ω—è—Ç—å, —Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—Ç—å, –ø–ª–∞—Ç–∏—Ç—å, —Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–∏—Ç—å, —Å–ª–µ–¥–∏—Ç—å, —É–º–Ω–æ–∂–∞—Ç—å. –í—Å–µ–≥–æ –∏ –Ω–µ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—á–∏—Å–ª–∏—Ç—å.\r\n\r\n–ö–∞–∫–∏–µ –ø—Ä–µ–∏–º—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –±—É–¥—É—Ç —É —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–∞?\r\n\r\n–û–¥–∏–Ω –¥–ª—è –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ. –ú—ã —Å–æ–±–∏—Ä–∞–µ–º –≤—Å–µ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å—ã –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –≤—ã –º–æ–≥–ª–∏ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤–µ—Å—å —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª –¥–ª—è –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã —Å —Ü–∏—Ñ—Ä–æ–≤—ã–º–∏ –≤–∞–ª—é—Ç–∞–º–∏.\r\n\r\n–ë–µ–∑–æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å - –º—ã –≤–æ—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –æ–ø—ã—Ç–æ–º –ø—Ä–µ–¥—ã–¥—É—â–∏—Ö –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–π, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –Ω–µ –¥–æ–ø—É—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—å –∏—Ö –æ—à–∏–±–æ–∫ –∏ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å –Ω–∞–¥–µ–∂–Ω—ã–π —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å.\r\n\r\n–ü—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–Ω–∏–∫ –≤ –º–∏—Ä –∫—Ä–∏–ø—Ç–æ–≤–∞–ª—é—Ç. –ú—ã –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ–º, —á—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–∏ –Ω–µ —Ä–æ–∂–¥–∞—é—Ç—Å—è, –∞ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤—è—Ç—Å—è. –ü—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—ã —Ä—ã–Ω–∫–∞ –¥–µ–ª—è—Ç—Å—è —Å–≤–æ–∏–º –æ–ø—ã—Ç–æ–º —Å –≤–∞–º–∏, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –≤—ã –º–æ–≥–ª–∏ –ø–æ –º–∞–∫—Å–∏–º—É–º—É –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞—à–µ–≥–æ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–∞.\r\n\r\n–î–ª—è –ª—é–¥–µ–π. –ë–æ–ª—å—à–µ –Ω–µ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–∞–º–∏, –ø–æ—Ö–æ–∂–∏–º–∏ –Ω–∞ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–ª–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—ã–µ —Ç–∞–±–ª–∏—Ü—ã. –ù–∞—à –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä—Ñ–µ–π—Å —Å–æ—á–µ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –≤ —Å–µ–±–µ –≤—Å–µ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏, –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–∞ —Ä—ã–Ω–∫–µ, –Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –Ω–µ –ø—ã—Ç–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤—ã—Ä–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤–∞–º –≥–ª–∞–∑.\r\n\r\n–û—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–æ—Å—Ç—å. –ù–∞–º –Ω–µ—á–µ–≥–æ —Å–∫—Ä—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å, –µ—Å–ª–∏ –≤—ã —á–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã–π —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫. –ò—Å—Ö–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ–¥, –æ–±–æ—Ä–æ—Ç —Å–µ—Ä–≤–∏—Å–∞, —Å—Ä–∞–≤–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤–∞—Å.\r\n\r\n–ö–æ—à–µ–ª–µ–∫ –ë–ª–æ–∫—á–µ–π–Ω ‚Äî –ú—ã –≤—ã–¥–∞–¥–∏–º –≤–∞–º –∫–ª—é—á–∏ –∏–ª–∏ —Ñ–∞–π–ª, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤ –∞–ø–ø–∞—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω—ã–π –∫–æ—à–µ–ª–µ–∫. –í—Å–µ –∫–ª—é—á–∏ –æ—Å—Ç–∞—é—Ç—Å—è —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω–∞ –≤–∞—à–µ–º —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–µ. –¢—Ä–∞–Ω–∑–∞–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –ø–æ–¥–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏.\r\n\r\n–ö–æ—à–µ–ª–µ–∫ –û—Ñ—Ñ–ª–∞–π–Ω ‚Äî –º–∞–≥–∞–∑–∏–Ω–∞—Ö-–ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞—Ö. –í –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –≤—ã –ø–ª–∞—Ç–∏—Ç–µ  –∫—Ä–∏–ø—Ç–æ–≤–∞–ª—é—Ç—É, –∞ –º–∞–≥–∞–∑–∏–Ω –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∞–µ—Ç –¥–µ–Ω—å–≥–∏.\r\n\r\n–ö–æ—à–µ–ª–µ–∫ –ö—É—Ä—Å—ã ‚Äî –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫—É —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–∑–∞–∫—Ü–∏–∏? –ú—ã —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–µ–º –±–ª–æ–∫—á–µ–π–Ω —ç–∫—Å–ø–ª–æ—Ä–µ—Ä –ø—Ä—è–º–æ –≤ –ø—Ä–∏–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–∏. –°–º–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ –æ—Ç—Å–ª–µ–∂–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–∑–∞–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –∏–ª–∏ –∫—Ä–∏–ø—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç –Ω–∞ –æ–Ω–ª–∞–π–Ω –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–µ –∏–ª–∏ –∂–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –æ–±–º–µ–Ω—è–π—Ç–µ –µ–µ –Ω–∞ —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ –≤–∞–º –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ.\r\n\r\n–ö–æ—à–µ–ª–µ–∫ –ö–∞—Å—Å–∞ ‚Äî –û—Ç–∫—Ä–æ–π—Ç–µ –Ω–æ–≤—ã–π
